title: Capstone
alt: The rover and base station of our capstone solution set up in a field.
description: For my BYU Capstone project, I worked with a team of five other graduating engineers. Our team was sponsered by L3 Technologies and tasked with making an autonomous system that could point to a given latitude, longitude, and azimuth with a high degree of accuracy.

title: Mechatronics
description: Together with a team of three other engineers, we took first place in the Fall 2016 BYU Mechatronics Competition. The task was to make a robot that would find a ping pong ball dispenser, gather up to six ping pong balls, and shoot or place them in one of three randomly activated goals.

title: Composites
description: While taking the Manufacturing Plastics Materials and Processing course, I designed and manufactured a custom tenor ukulele out of carbon fiber and fiberglass. I first made a three-dimensional computer model of a ukulele using SOLIDWORKS modeling software. While working on this project I developed skills in composites manufacturing, resin infusion, layup, and Solidworks modeling and drafting.

title: Velocity
description: Velocity is a full-stack application that helps users accomplish goals through planning tasks and tracking meals. This application uses Sequelize to create a SQL database of users, tasks, and meals.
